comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Four Douglas AD-6 / A-1H Skyraiders in echelon right formation (from aircraft furthest away) all in Light Gull Gray and Insignia White. Bu No 139613 Modex 407 Bu No 139633 Modex 406 Bu No 139626 Modex 404 Bu No 139624 Modex 412 Wearing decorative Carrier Air Wing Fourteen (CVW-14) code NK in a lighter hue on tail, repeated black in normal manner on wing. Date of picture unknown, possibly late 1950s or early 1960s. All belonging to VA-145 ‘Swordsmen’. www.gonavy.jp/navy/sqn/VA145.html As part of CVG-14 / CVW-14, VA-145 had the AD-6 / A-1H between 1958 & 1966. AD-6 / A-1H 139626 is recorded as being transferred to the Vietnam Air Force of the then Republic of South Vietnam. Unfortunately there is as yet no known internet accessible info on the history or fates of AD-6 / A-1H 139613, 139624 & 139633. Picture of same formation of above four aircraft with AD-6 / A-1H 139613 included as Modex 407 of VA-145 near NAS El Centro California: groups.yahoo.com/group/PropNavy/attachments/folder/185528... AD-6 / A-1H 139633 was chosen as the subject for a 1/48th scale set of model decals: www.squadron.com/ProfileDetails.asp?item=EP48006 Eagle Strike Douglas Skyraider Aircraft Decals EP48006 AD-6 / A-1H 139633, VA-145 Modex 407 NAS Fallon NV '50's,
